import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Simulate 10,000 experiments of 100 coin flips each
flips = np.random.randint(0, 2, size=(10000, 100))
heads_counts = flips.sum(axis=1)

plt.hist(heads_counts, bins=30)
plt.xlabel('Number of Heads')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.title('Distribution of Heads in 100 Flips')
plt.show()

def permutation_test(group_a, group_b, n_iterations=10000):
    """Perform permutation test for difference in means."""
    observed_diff = np.mean(group_a) - np.mean(group_b)
    combined = np.concatenate([group_a, group_b])
    
    permuted_diffs = []
    for _ in range(n_iterations):
        np.random.shuffle(combined)
        perm_a = combined[:len(group_a)]
        perm_b = combined[len(group_a):]
        permuted_diffs.append(np.mean(perm_a) - np.mean(perm_b))
    
    p_value = np.mean(np.abs(permuted_diffs) >= np.abs(observed_diff))
    return p_value, observed_diff

def bootstrap_ci(data, n_bootstrap=10000, confidence=0.95):
    """Calculate bootstrap confidence interval."""
    bootstrap_means = []
    for _ in range(n_bootstrap):
        sample = np.random.choice(data, size=len(data), replace=True)
        bootstrap_means.append(np.mean(sample))
    
    alpha = 1 - confidence
    lower = np.percentile(bootstrap_means, 100 * alpha / 2)
    upper = np.percentile(bootstrap_means, 100 * (1 - alpha / 2))
    return lower, upper
